articles.description: When the full-time whistle was blown in Sydney, it felt like the Lionesses' best opportunity to win a Women's World Cup had passed them by.
articles.title: Lionesses miss opportunity to cement legend status

articles.description: Katarina Johnson-Thompson says winning world heptathlon gold in Budapest is "like being in a dream" on a stellar night for GB in Budapest.
articles.title: 'This time I didn't get my heart broken'

articles.description: Watch the winning moment as Great Britain's Katarina Johnson-Thompson secures heptathlon gold in a thrilling 800m race.
articles.title: Johnson-Thompson wins heptathlon gold in 800m thriller

articles.description: Olga Carmona, who scored Spain's winner in the Women's World Cup final, is told after the game against England that her father has died.
articles.title: Spain's Carmona told after final her father had died

articles.description: England's wait to win a first Women's World Cup goes on after defeat by Spain in the 2023 final in Sydney.
articles.title: Spain beat England to win the Women's World Cup

articles.description: MOTD2 pundit Martin Keown says it was worrying to see exactly how bad Everton's basics were in the 4-0 defeat at Aston Villa on Sunday.
articles.title: 'A dark day for Everton - and now the pressure is on'

articles.description: Watch as Great Britain's Zharnel Hughes takes bronze in the men's 100m, while Noah Lyles of the United States wins gold.
articles.title: GB's Hughes takes bronze as Lyles wins 100m title

articles.description: West Ham United manager David Moyes says there was "never any doubt" about playing Lucas Paqueta in the 3-1 win against Chelsea.
articles.title: Never any doubts about playing Paqueta - Moyes

articles.description: Watch Katarina Johnson-Thompson's performances in all seven events as she becomes world heptathlon champion for the second time.
articles.title: Watch: How Johnson-Thompson won heptathlon gold

articles.description: After Celtic having never lost a domestic cup game under Brendan Rodgers, Kilmarnock shock them in the first tie of the manager's second spell.
articles.title: 'Wee advantage' leaves Rodgers with questions
